lessons.title: Foundations of Reiki
lessons.subtitle: The history and principles of Usui Reiki

sections.content: Hey {name}! I'm so excited you're here to learn about Reiki. This ancient healing art has transformed countless lives - including my own. In this lesson, we'll explore what Reiki is, where it comes from, and why it's such a powerful tool for healing.

Reiki (pronounced RAY-key) is a Japanese healing technique that channels universal life force energy through the practitioner's hands. The word itself comes from two Japanese words: 'Rei' meaning universal or spiritual, and 'Ki' meaning life force energy.

Reiki is not about using YOUR energy to heal others. You are a CHANNEL for universal energy. This is why Reiki practitioners don't get drained from sessions - they're not depleting themselves. In fact, many practitioners feel energized after giving treatments.

Reiki was developed in Japan in the early 1920s by Dr. Mikao Usui. After years of studying ancient texts and spiritual practices, he had a profound mystical experience on Mount Kurama that opened him to channel healing energy.

items: Dr. Mikao Usui - Founder of Usui Reiki (1922)
Dr. Chujiro Hayashi - Developed hand positions and treatment protocols
Hawayo Takata - Brought Reiki to the West in the 1930s
Modern practitioners - Reiki now practiced worldwide in hospitals and wellness centers

sections.content: Reiki is more than just a healing technique - it's a way of life. Dr. Usui gave us five principles to live by:

items: Just for today, I will not worry
Just for today, I will not be angry
Just for today, I will be grateful
Just for today, I will do my work honestly
Just for today, I will be kind to every living thing

sections.content: These principles are meant to be meditated on daily. They remind us that we can only live one day at a time. When we release worry and anger, we open ourselves to be better channels for healing energy.

From a scientific perspective, Reiki works by shifting the body from a stress state (sympathetic nervous system) to a relaxation state (parasympathetic). In this relaxed state, the body's natural healing mechanisms can work more effectively.

I was skeptical at first - really skeptical. But after my first Reiki session, I felt something I couldn't explain. A deep peace washed over me. Now, three years later, I have a thriving practice helping others experience that same transformation. - Michelle K., Reiki Practitioner
In the next lesson, we'll explore the human energy system - the chakras, aura, and energy meridians that you'll be working with as a Reiki practitioner.

keyTakeaways: Reiki means 'universal life force energy' in Japanese
You are a channel, not the source - you don't use your own energy
Dr. Mikao Usui founded Reiki in Japan in the 1920s
The Five Reiki Principles are a daily practice for practitioners
Reiki activates the body's parasympathetic (relaxation) response

lessons.title: The Human Energy System
lessons.subtitle: Understanding chakras and energy flow

sections.content: Welcome back, {name}! Now that you understand what Reiki is, let's explore the energy system you'll be working with. Understanding chakras and energy flow is essential for effective Reiki practice.

Beyond your physical body, you have an energy body (also called the subtle body or aura). This energy field extends several feet around you and contains information about your physical, emotional, mental, and spiritual states.

As a Reiki practitioner, you'll learn to sense this energy body. Some feel it as warmth, tingling, or subtle pressure. Others 'just know' where energy is blocked. Both are valid - trust your own experience.

Chakras are spinning wheels of energy located along your spine. The word 'chakra' comes from Sanskrit meaning 'wheel.' Each chakra governs specific physical, emotional, and spiritual aspects of your being.

items: Root (Red) - Base of spine - Safety, security, grounding
Sacral (Orange) - Below navel - Creativity, emotions, sexuality
Solar Plexus (Yellow) - Stomach - Personal power, confidence
Heart (Green) - Chest center - Love, compassion, connection
Throat (Blue) - Throat - Communication, truth, expression
Third Eye (Indigo) - Between eyebrows - Intuition, insight
Crown (Violet) - Top of head - Spirituality, divine connection

sections.content: When chakras are blocked or imbalanced, physical and emotional symptoms appear. As a Reiki practitioner, you'll learn to sense these imbalances and channel energy to restore flow.

items: Root blocked: Financial anxiety, feeling unsafe, leg/foot issues
Sacral blocked: Creative blocks, emotional numbness, hip problems
Solar Plexus blocked: Low self-esteem, digestive issues
Heart blocked: Difficulty with love, respiratory problems
Throat blocked: Fear of speaking, thyroid issues
Third Eye blocked: Lack of clarity, headaches
Crown blocked: Spiritual disconnection, depression

sections.content: You don't need to diagnose or 'fix' specific chakras. Reiki energy is intelligent - it goes where it's needed. Trust the energy and trust the process.
Beyond chakras, energy flows through pathways called meridians (also used in acupuncture). Reiki helps clear these pathways, allowing life force to flow freely throughout the body.
In the next lesson, we'll learn how to connect to universal energy - the essential skill that makes Reiki healing possible.

keyTakeaways: The energy body (aura) extends beyond your physical body
Seven main chakras run from base of spine to crown of head
Each chakra governs specific physical, emotional, and spiritual aspects
Chakra imbalances create predictable symptom patterns
Reiki energy is intelligent - it goes where it's needed

lessons.title: Connecting to Universal Energy
lessons.subtitle: Opening yourself as a channel

sections.content: {name}, this lesson is at the heart of Reiki practice. Before you can channel healing energy, you need to learn how to connect to it. This is what separates Reiki from other healing modalities.
In traditional Reiki training, students receive 'attunements' - energetic initiations that open them as channels for Reiki energy. Think of an attunement as tuning a radio to the right frequency.

The attunement doesn't give you something new - it awakens and amplifies what's already within you. Everyone has the capacity to channel healing energy. The attunement simply strengthens this connection.
Before every Reiki session, you should center and ground yourself. This ensures you're working from a clear, stable place.

items: Sit comfortably with feet flat on the floor
Close your eyes and take three deep breaths
Imagine roots growing from your feet deep into the earth
Feel the earth's stable, supportive energy rising up through you
Now imagine a beam of light from above entering through your crown
Let these two energies meet and blend at your heart center

sections.content: Once you're centered and grounded, you can invoke Reiki. This is as simple as setting the intention to be a channel for healing energy.

Try this now: Rub your palms together vigorously for 10 seconds. Then hold them facing each other about 6 inches apart. Slowly bring them closer and further apart. Do you feel a subtle pressure, warmth, or tingling? That's energy!
Intention is everything in Reiki. When you set a clear intention to channel healing energy, the universe responds. You don't need to force anything - simply intend, then allow.

I used to think I had to 'do' something to make Reiki work. Now I understand my job is to get out of the way. I center, ground, intend, and then become an empty vessel. The energy knows what to do. - Patricia W., Reiki Master
Some practitioners like to set energetic protection before sessions. A simple visualization of white light surrounding you works well. This isn't about fear - it's about maintaining clear boundaries.
In the next lesson, we'll learn the traditional hand positions used in Reiki treatments. These positions ensure energy reaches all the major areas of the body.

keyTakeaways: Attunements awaken and amplify your natural ability to channel energy
Always center and ground before giving Reiki
Intention is the key - intend to be a channel, then allow
Your job is to get out of the way and let energy flow
Setting energetic boundaries maintains clarity during sessions

lessons.title: Hand Positions & Techniques
lessons.subtitle: The 12 traditional hand placements

sections.content: Welcome to the practical heart of your Reiki training, {name}! In this lesson, you'll learn the traditional hand positions that form the basis of a complete Reiki treatment. These positions ensure healing energy reaches all major areas of the body.

Traditional Reiki uses 12 standard hand positions - four on the head, four on the front of the torso, and four on the back. You'll hold each position for 3-5 minutes, or until you feel the energy shift.

Your hands should be relaxed and gently cupped, fingers together. You can either touch lightly or hold hands a few inches above the body. Both work - some clients prefer no touch, and that's perfectly fine.

items: Position 1: Hands over the eyes (covers third eye chakra)
Position 2: Hands on temples (both sides of the head)
Position 3: Hands cupping back of head (occipital region)
Position 4: Hands at throat (covers throat chakra - hover if client prefers)
Position 5: Hands on upper chest (heart chakra)
Position 6: Hands over solar plexus (below ribs)
Position 7: Hands on lower belly (sacral chakra)
Position 8: Hands on hip bones (root chakra area)
Position 9: Hands on upper back (between shoulder blades)
Position 10: Hands on middle back (behind solar plexus)
Position 11: Hands on lower back (behind sacral chakra)
Position 12: Hands on sacrum/base of spine (root chakra)

sections.content: Don't worry about memorizing all positions perfectly right now. With practice, your hands will naturally know where to go. The positions are guidelines, not rigid rules.
As you hold each position, you may experience:

items: Heat or warmth in your palms
Tingling or buzzing sensations
Pulsing or throbbing
A feeling of energy flowing through you
Sometimes, nothing at all - and that's okay too!

sections.content: At first I felt nothing and thought I was doing it wrong. My teacher told me to trust the process. After about two weeks of practice, I started feeling the energy clearly. Now it's as natural as breathing. - Karen L., Reiki Practitioner
Before you work on others, you must learn to heal yourself. In the next lesson, we'll cover self-treatment - the most important practice for any Reiki practitioner.

keyTakeaways: 12 traditional hand positions cover all major areas of the body
Hold each position for 3-5 minutes or until you feel energy shift
Hands can either touch lightly or hover above the body
Common sensations include heat, tingling, and pulsing
Positions are guidelines - your intuition will guide you with practice

lessons.title: Self-Healing Practice
lessons.subtitle: Treating yourself first â€” essential!

sections.content: {name}, this might be the most important lesson in this entire course. Before you can effectively help others, you MUST practice Reiki on yourself. Self-treatment is not optional - it's the foundation of everything.

items: Clears your own energy so you can be a purer channel
Develops your sensitivity to feeling energy
Maintains your health and well-being as a practitioner
Builds the muscle memory for hand positions
Deepens your personal connection to Reiki

sections.content: A blocked or depleted practitioner cannot channel energy effectively. Think of yourself as a garden hose - if the hose is kinked, water can't flow through. Daily self-treatment keeps your energy channels open.
A complete self-treatment follows the same hand positions, but adapted for self-application:

items: Eyes (covering your own eyes with palms)
Temples (both sides of your head)
Back of head (cup your occipital region)
Throat (hover or light touch)
Heart/chest area
Solar plexus
Lower belly
As much of your back as you can reach

sections.content: Can't reach your back easily? No problem. Simply place your hands on your front and intend for the energy to flow through to your back. Reiki follows intention.
The ideal practice is daily self-treatment, but any Reiki is better than none:

items: First thing in the morning (sets positive tone for the day)
Before bed (promotes restful sleep)
While watching TV or relaxing
When stressed or anxious
When feeling unwell
Before giving Reiki to others

sections.content: After receiving a Reiki attunement, practitioners traditionally do 21 days of daily self-treatment. This clears old energy patterns and strengthens the new connection. Even without a formal attunement, a 21-day self-treatment commitment will deepen your practice significantly.

I committed to 21 days of self-treatment and my life changed. Old emotional patterns came up to be released. By day 21, I felt like a new person. Now I never skip my daily Reiki. It's like brushing my teeth - non-negotiable. - Michelle K., Reiki Practitioner
Once you've established a self-treatment practice, you're ready to learn how to give Reiki to others. That's what we'll cover in the next lesson.

keyTakeaways: Self-treatment is not optional - it's the foundation of Reiki practice
Daily self-treatment keeps your energy channels clear
Follow the same hand positions adapted for self-application
21 days of daily self-treatment creates powerful transformation
Always self-treat before giving Reiki to others

lessons.title: Working with Clients
lessons.subtitle: Session structure and flow

sections.content: Now that you've established your self-practice, {name}, let's learn how to give Reiki to others. This lesson covers the complete flow of a client session from start to finish.
Preparation is essential for effective sessions. Here's what to do before your client arrives:

items: Clear your space (physically and energetically)
Prepare a comfortable treatment table or massage chair
Have a blanket ready (clients often get cold)
Play soft, relaxing music if desired
Give yourself Reiki to clear and center
Set your intention for the highest good of the client

sections.content: Every session should begin with a brief conversation. Ask about:

items: Why they're seeking Reiki today
Any physical areas of concern
Their experience with energy healing (any or none)
Preferences for touch vs. hovering hands
Any questions or concerns

sections.content: Explain that Reiki is not massage - they remain fully clothed. Let them know they might experience heat, tingling, or emotional release. Reassure them that falling asleep is perfectly normal and welcomed.
A typical Reiki session lasts 45-60 minutes. Here's the flow:

items: Client lies down (face up to start)
Take a moment to center and ground yourself
Silently invoke Reiki energy
Begin with head positions (15-20 minutes)
Move to front torso (15-20 minutes)
Have client turn over (if doing back)
Complete back positions (10-15 minutes)
End with hands at feet to ground the energy

sections.content: Trust your intuition during sessions. If you feel drawn to stay longer in one position, do so. If you feel guided to place hands somewhere not in the standard sequence, follow that guidance. Reiki is intuitive work.
Give clients a few minutes to come back to full awareness. Offer water. Ask about their experience but don't interpret - let them process in their own way.

I had a client who cried throughout her entire first session. I just held space. Afterward, she said she'd released grief she'd been carrying for ten years. That's the power of simply being present and allowing energy to work. - Sarah, Reiki Master
One of the most powerful aspects of Reiki is the ability to send healing energy across distance. In the next lesson, we'll learn this advanced technique.

keyTakeaways: Prepare your space and yourself before clients arrive
Always do an intake conversation before the session
A typical session lasts 45-60 minutes covering all positions
Trust your intuition - follow guidance that comes during sessions
Allow clients time to integrate; offer water and space to process

lessons.title: Distance Reiki
lessons.subtitle: Healing across time and space

sections.content: {name}, this lesson introduces one of the most fascinating aspects of Reiki - the ability to send healing energy across any distance. Distance Reiki allows you to help clients who aren't physically present.

At the quantum level, everything is connected. Time and space are not the barriers they seem to be in ordinary consciousness. In Reiki Level II, students traditionally learn the 'Distance Symbol' (Hon Sha Ze Sho Nen) which facilitates this connection.

Distance Reiki works just as effectively as in-person sessions. Studies have shown measurable effects on recipients who were unaware they were receiving Reiki. The energy doesn't weaken with distance - it's not like a flashlight beam that fades.
There are several techniques for sending Reiki across distance:

items: Visualization - Picture the person in your mind's eye and send energy
Proxy - Use a teddy bear, pillow, or photo as a stand-in
Beaming - Hold your hands out and beam energy like a lighthouse
Thigh technique - Place hands on your thighs representing the recipient
Mini-person - Imagine a small version of the person in your hands
Get permission from the recipient (essential!)
Schedule a time (recipient can be relaxing or going about their day)
Center and ground yourself as usual
State your intention: 'I am sending Reiki to [name] for their highest good'
Use your preferred distance method
Send for 15-30 minutes
Close the session with gratitude

sections.content: Always get permission before sending Reiki to someone. The exception is sending Reiki 'for the highest good of all' or to situations rather than specific people. Respect free will.
You can also send Reiki to past events (to heal old trauma) or future events (to prepare for something challenging). Energy is not bound by linear time.

I sent distance Reiki to my daughter before her surgery. The surgeon said she was the calmest patient he'd ever had. She recovered faster than expected. I don't tell everyone about this, but I know it made a difference. - Patricia W., Reiki Practitioner

Many practitioners now offer live virtual sessions via Zoom or phone. The client relaxes at home while you guide them and send Reiki. This has become increasingly popular and is a great way to expand your practice geographically.
In the next lesson, we'll cover the ethical foundations of Reiki practice and how to build a successful healing business.

keyTakeaways: Distance Reiki works as effectively as in-person sessions
Energy is not limited by time or space
Multiple methods exist: visualization, proxy, beaming
Always get permission before sending Reiki to specific people
Virtual sessions via Zoom are a valid and popular option

lessons.title: Ethics & Building Your Practice
lessons.subtitle: Professional boundaries and growth

sections.content: {name}, as you prepare to share Reiki with others, we need to discuss the ethical foundations of practice. This lesson also covers the practical aspects of building your Reiki business.

items: Do no harm - Work only for the highest good
Get consent - Always obtain permission before treatment
Maintain boundaries - Keep relationships professional
Don't diagnose - Leave medical diagnosis to doctors
Don't prescribe - Never advise stopping medical treatment
Honor confidentiality - What happens in session stays private
Stay within scope - Be clear about what Reiki is and isn't

sections.content: You are NOT a medical professional (unless you have separate credentials). Never diagnose conditions or claim to cure diseases. Reiki is complementary to medical care, not a replacement for it.
Be honest about what Reiki is. Good language includes:

items: 'Reiki promotes relaxation and may support your body's natural healing'
'Many people report feeling calmer and more balanced after Reiki'
'Reiki can be a lovely complement to your medical care'
'I don't treat specific conditions - I support overall wellbeing'
Decide on location (home, rented space, mobile, virtual)
Create intake and consent forms
Set your pricing (research your local market)
Get liability insurance (affordable and important)
Consider a simple website or social media presence
New practitioners: $60-80 per session
Established practitioners: $85-125 per session
Experienced/Master level: $125-200 per session
Package discounts (4-6 sessions): 10-15% off

sections.content: Packages work better than single sessions. Healing takes time. Recommend 3-4 initial sessions so clients can experience cumulative benefits. This also provides income stability.

items: Start with friends and family (discounted practice sessions)
Ask satisfied clients for referrals
Partner with yoga studios, massage therapists, chiropractors
Offer introductory sessions at reduced rates
Share client testimonials (with permission)
Create educational content about Reiki

sections.content: I started by offering free sessions to friends. Word spread. Within six months, I had a steady stream of paying clients. Now I work 15 hours a week and earn more than I did in my corporate job. And I love what I do. - Karen L., Reiki Practitioner
In our final lesson, we'll discuss your path forward and how to claim your certificate!

keyTakeaways: Never diagnose, prescribe, or claim to cure diseases
Always get informed consent before treatment
Reiki complements medical care - it doesn't replace it
Packages are better for clients and provide income stability
Word of mouth from satisfied clients is your best marketing

lessons.title: Your Next Step
lessons.subtitle: Your path to Reiki mastery

sections.content: Congratulations, {name}! You've completed your foundational training in Reiki Healing. You now understand the principles, techniques, and ethics of this beautiful healing art. Let's talk about what comes next.

items: The history and principles of Usui Reiki
The human energy system and chakras
How to connect to and channel universal energy
The 12 traditional hand positions
Self-healing practice (the essential foundation)
Working with clients in session
Distance Reiki across time and space
Ethics and building your practice

sections.content: This mini diploma gives you the foundation. True mastery comes from practice. Start with daily self-treatment, then practice on friends and family. With time, your sensitivity and skills will deepen.
Traditional Reiki training has three levels:

items: Level I (Shoden) - Self-healing and treating others (this foundation)
Level II (Okuden) - Symbols, distance healing, deeper practice
Level III (Shinpiden/Master) - Teaching others, advanced techniques

sections.content: After completing the final exam, you'll receive your Reiki Healing Foundation Certificate. This certification is accredited by the Accreditation Service for International Schools (ASI).
Your certificate can be displayed in your practice, on your website, and on your social media. It shows clients you've been trained in authentic Reiki principles and techniques.
This mini diploma is a powerful foundation. Many of our graduates choose to deepen their practice with our full certification programs:

items: Full Reiki Level I-III Master Certification
Live attunement ceremonies with a Reiki Master
Business mentorship for building your practice
Ongoing practitioner community and support

sections.content: Click below to take your certification exam. It covers key concepts from all 9 lessons. Most students complete it in 10-15 minutes. You need to pass to receive your certificate.
You've got this! The exam tests understanding, not memorization. Trust what you've learned. Most students pass on their first try.

keyTakeaways: You now have the foundational knowledge for Reiki practice
Daily self-treatment is essential for developing your skills
Traditional Reiki has three levels - this covers Level I foundations
Your certificate shows clients you're professionally trained
Take the exam to claim your certificate and start your practice!
